meanings.sent1: The teacher decided to reimpose the rule of raising hands before speaking.
meanings.sent2: After the chaos, the principal had to reimpose order in the school.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept reimposing its presence by sitting on the keyboard whenever I tried to work.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to reimpose their gloom over the city, casting a shadow over everyone.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the marching band reimposing its rhythm echoed through the stadium.

meanings.definition: To restore the imposition of something previously removed
meanings.sent1: The government decided to reimpose the ban on plastic bags to protect the environment.
meanings.sent2: She had to reimpose the lock on the door after realizing it was left unlocked.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf kept reimposing the prank of switching sugar with salt in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the past flood seemed to reimpose their weight on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell was so powerful that it felt like he was reimposing reality itself.
